TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1493
TEI.2.document_title: J. C. Payton to Stephen F. Austin, 11-06-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: J. C. Payton to Austin, November 6, 1826. Application for land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1493

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. C. Payton to Austin, November 6, 1826. Application for land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-06-1826">November 6th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* */p*
*p*after a silence of several months, I deliberately Take up my pen to Enquire of you your Feelings respecting my Geting Land in your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*I hope you may not Entertain The Feeling you seam to Express when we Last Talked togeather I feel willing to believe you do not as theare was some Wormth of Feeling Excited*/p*
*p*I hope you will reconsider the Subject and give a more satisfactory reply whitch I shall ask of you on the reception of those few lines Or so soon as is Convenient*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. C. Payton*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
